name: outhit
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in tennis or boxing, to hit harder than someone else, or, in golf, to hit a ball further than someone else: She has such a powerful backhand that you'll never succeed in outhitting her. He was regularly outhitting me off the tee but I was holing more putts.
in baseball, to have more batters (= people trying to hit the ball) safely reach first base after hitting the ball than the other team: The Reds outhit the Blues 12-6.
More examplesFewer examplesHe wasn't that nimble a boxer but would win matches by simply outhitting his opponent.It was a crushing straight-sets defeat in which he was out-thought and out-hit.
